hero_subtitle: Begin your journey toward a rewarding career in optometry. Discover our comprehensive admission process and requirements.
eligibility_description: Review our program requirements to ensure you meet the criteria for admission

requirements: Completed 12th grade or PUC with English, Physics, Chemistry, Maths/Biology
Minimum 35% aggregate marks in science subjects

process_description: Follow these steps to complete your application successfully

admission_steps.title: Filling application form
admission_steps.description: Complete the application form with all required details

admission_steps.title: Uploading merit documents
admission_steps.description: Upload all necessary academic and personal documents

admission_steps.title: Entrance exam and interview
admission_steps.description: Appear for written test, practical assessment, personal interview and academic counseling session

admission_steps.title: Selection of candidates
admission_steps.description: Selection of candidates based on merit and eligibility

admission_steps.title: Admission letter and fee payment
admission_steps.description: Receive admission letter and complete the fee payment

Attested copy of Plus Two or equivalent mark list

A self addressed envelope with Rs. 5/- stamp affixed
important_notes_list: Original Certificates should be produced only at the time of admission.
The completed application form with all enclosures should be forwarded to The Principal.
faq_description: Find answers to common questions about our admission process

faq_list.question: What is the application deadline for the Bachelor of Optometry program?
faq_list.answer: The application deadline is typically June for the academic year starting in September. However, we recommend applying early as seats are limited and filled on a first-come, first-served basis among qualified candidates.

faq_list.question: Are there any scholarship opportunities available?
faq_list.answer: Yes, we offer various scholarships including merit-based scholarships for top performers, need-based financial aid, and special scholarships for students from underrepresented communities. Details are available during the counseling process.

faq_list.question: What documents are required for admission?
faq_list.answer: Required documents include: academic transcripts, entrance exam scores, identity proof, address proof, caste certificate (if applicable), medical certificate, passport-size photographs.

faq_list.question: What is the fee structure?
faq_list.answer: The fee structure varies for Bachelor of Optometry. Additional costs include hostel fees, examination fees, and practical lab charges. Detailed fee structure is provided during admission counseling.
